section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date"), by and between [ * * * ] (the "Provider"), and TELCOSTAR PTE, LTD., a company organized and existing under the laws of Singapore and Ability Computer & Software Industries Ltd, a company organized and existing under the laws of the State of Israel (each and both of them "Recipient").
explanation: The agreement lists both TELCOSTAR PTE, LTD. and Ability Computer & Software Industries Ltd. as 'Recipient' but defines 'Recipient' in the singular. This creates ambiguity as to whether obligations and rights apply jointly or severally to these two entities.

section: Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider.
explanation: While the contract states that Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider, section 1.3 states that 'Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to prevent the Recipient from itself performing or from acquiring services from other providers that are similar to or identical to the Services.' It is unclear if the recipient is allowed to use employees from other companies that are contracted to the provider. This can be seen as ambiguous.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The phrase "This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement" is structurally flawed and does not make grammatical sense, this raises confusion in its legal meaning. It's unclear if 'Agreement' is supposed to reference another document or if it is an error in the sentence.
